prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation (euler\_angles = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and no translation (translation\_vector = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]). Next, draw the 2D sketch to represent the front face of the prism on the X-Y plane, which is the plane defined by the coordinate system. 1. Draw a horizontal line (line\_1) from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.3, 0.0]. 2. Draw a vertical line (line\_2) from point [0.3, 0.0] to point [0.3, 0.15]. 3. Draw a horizontal line (line\_3) from point [0.3, 0.15] to point [0.0, 0.15]. 4. Close the loop by drawing a vertical line (line\_4) from point [0.0, 0.15] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3 using the sketch\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.75 units towards the positive Z-direction, which is the direction normal to the 2D sketch plane. Part 2: A cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, and a smooth surface. Create a new coordinate system with rotation (euler\_angles = [0.0, 0.0, -90.0]) around the Z-axis and translation (translation\_vector = [0.1013, 0.0, 0.2513]). Draw the 2D sketch for the circular cross-section of the cylinder using the new coordinate system as reference. 1. Draw a circle (circle\_1) centered at point [0.0488, 0.0487] with a radius of 0.0488. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0975 using the sketch\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate system. Cut the 3D sketch from the previous part using the cylindrical cross-section and extrude it along the Z-axis by 0.3 units towards the negative direction, which is opposite to the normal of the previous part. The resulting CAD model should match the final desired shape of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions for each part are as follows: * Part 1: length = 0.3, width = 0.3, height = 0.75 * Part 2: length = 0.0975, width = 0.3, height = 0.0975 The described CAD model creation process is based on the given CAD Assembly JSON and adheres to the instructions specified in the prompt.</description>
